qa_pair.question: Does this shredder have continuous feed? If so, is it limited?
qa_pair.answer: It can continuously shred paper for 10 mins straight. However, if you do it at a more moderate pace it won't overheat that qucikly.

qa_pair.question: Does this shredder have continuous feed? If so, is it limited?
qa_pair.answer: This shredder does not have a continuous feed per se.  That is, it does not have any kind of apparatus or tray (like on a fax machine) that would allow you to load say a large number of pieces to be shredded, and have either gravity or a roller (like what they have in small printers) pull the product down into the shredder.  You can continuously feed pieces to be shredded, one at a time, manually into the shredder and it will handle that.   Hope that helps.  Overall, it is a very good shredder and very quiet.

qa_pair.question: Does this shredder have continuous feed? If so, is it limited?
qa_pair.answer: I does stay active for several seconds after the sheet(s) are shredded, so you could call that continuous feed. It does get rather warm after continued use for a lot of shredding. If you need to shred a high volume of paper, I would look for a more heavy duty (and continuous duty) machine. For home use or even small business, it is a great machine.

qa_pair.question: Does this shredder have continuous feed? If so, is it limited?
qa_pair.answer: Not sure what you mean by continuous.  It is limited by numbers of sheets you can put in at a time (max seems to be 10). qa_pair.question: Can you have more than one person on the phone at one time,  without dialing another handset?
qa_pair.answer: Multiple people in the household can share in one "outside" conversation - one on each handset at the same time.  You can't dial another number e. g., call a second party from a second handset while someone is talking on the first handset to the original party.  You would have to have two separate telephone lines with two separate base telephone units - one connected to each of the two separate lines - in order to conduct two independent conversations at the same time.  I hope I haven't created confusion!

qa_pair.question: What are the major differences between the doxie go and doxie one scanners?
qa_pair.answer: Doxie one utilizes 300 DPI scanning, whereas Doxie Go utilizes 300 and 600 for archives. The Doxie Go has a rechargeable battery, saves scans to external USB/SD Card or wireless Eye-fi SD card. The Doxie One will let you save to internal memory and then connect via USB to your PC or Mac. A more details comparison can be found here: http://getdoxie.com/info/compare.html

rewrite.edit: The differences between the doxie go and doxie one are the doxie go has a rechargeable battery and can save scans to an external USB.
Doxie one utilizes 300 DPI scanning, whereas Doxie Go utilizes 300 and 600 for archives. The Doxie Go has a rechargeable battery, saves scans to external USB/SD Card or wireless Eye-fi SD card.

The Doxie Go and Doxie One scanners have a few major differences. The Doxie One allows you to save to internal memory that can later be connected through USB, while the Doxie Go saves scans to an external device, such as a USB/SC or wireless SD card. The Go version includes a rechargeable battery. Also the DPI scanning is utilized different, 300 for the Doxie One, and both 300 and 600 for archives with the Doxie Go.

qa_pair.question: What are the major differences between the doxie go and doxie one scanners?
qa_pair.answer: I have not used a Doxie One but I do have a Doxie Go.The difference that I purchased the Doxie Go was for that it is completely portable. I can insert an SD card or flash drive and it scans to it and I can then open it on any computer.. you do not need a computer to scan.. This feature makes it very handy to take with you and scan then put it on your computer or leave it on the flash or SD.. I can tuck it into my purse.. The scans are very clear..

qa_pair.question: Has anyone tried to OCR something like a WalMart receipt? This could be a handy tool for budgeting, but Wal-Mart receipts are not all that clear, IMO.
qa_pair.answer: For an OCR solution you should attempt to process the image via Evernote or Adobe Acrobat.They will do a secondary pass on the image to determine text and Evernote will then let you search terms in the receipt.

rewrite.edit: If you are trying to scan a OCR something, it would be better to process it via Evernote or Adobe Acrobat as this cannot do it adequately.
For an OCR solution you should attempt to process the image via Evernote or Adobe Acrobat. Evernote will then let you search terms in the receipt.

For OCR with objects, a program such as Evernote or Adobe Acrobat is recommended. These programs will do a secondary pass on a Wal-Mart receipt, or other item. Evernote will allow you to search terms in the receipt.

summary: This product includes the Doxie Go worldwide power adapter and can scan a side in one pass while being quiet. The differences between the Doxie Go and Doxie one are the Doxie Go has a rechargeable battery and can save scans to an external USB. This product is able to scan business cards without issue however, this product can only scan one side at a time and cannot do a two sided document in one pass. The Doxie Go would require two passes for a double sided item. There is a USB cable available to use to link to a computer.

qa_pair.question: Can you find software for a Mac or is it only PC.?
qa_pair.answer: There was a beta version of a Uniden compatible programming tool for Mac OS that apparently never quite got off the ground.  You can search for bcprogtool-tcl but it appears never to have made it out of beta.  Better bet is probably to buy one of the newer scanners that has the Home Patrol feature where the database is pre-loaded into the scanner and you punch in your zip code to have the scanner load frequencies in your area.  However, to update the database, you will still need a PC to run the Uniden Sentinel Software periodically.

qa_pair.question: Can this scanner be used without connecting it to a computer?
qa_pair.answer: Yes the BCD996XT does not require a computer. However, it require extensive programming, especially if you are monitoring a trunking system.  It is much easier and faster to do this programming on a computer then upload it to the scanner rather than use the keypad to enter the data. A computer interface cable is provided with the scanner.

qa_pair.question: Can this scanner be used without connecting it to a computer?

From everything I read, and encountered on my own attempts, I feel it is probably the only way to have it programmed.  Do not expect it to work right from the box.  It appears to be a very sturdy, durable unit I am still waiting to hear it for myself.  I hope this helps.

qa_pair.question: Can this scanner be used without connecting it to a computer?
qa_pair.answer:
Yes.   It is a stand alone device capable of operating out of the box.  You can operate it a.  Independently from a computer. b. Control the scanner from a computer or c.  Use the computer only to program the scanner.   Personally, I wouldn't dream of attempting to program all 25,000 memory locations manually but it is possible to manually input some individual channels if you're happy with the system defaults.   I use a 3rd party program "FreeScan" (www.sixspotsoftware.com that links with radioreference.com and imports the data directly into a program that can be uploaded into the scanner.   Good luck.  73

qa_pair.question: Is the speakerphone full duplex?
qa_pair.answer: Full duplex.  When using the speaker phone, both parties (caller and you) can talk at the same time.  The phone will transmit your voice and let you hear the calling party simultaneously.  Without full duplex the two parties have to take turns talking.  If both try to talk simultaneously the phone cuts out the conversation and you hear nothing.  In this instance the phone can either transmit your voice or reproduce the voice of the caller; one at a time.  It cannot do both at the same time.

rewrite.edit: This speakerphone is full duplex. When you use the speaker phone both parties can talk at the same time. The phone will transmit your voice and let you hear the calling party at the same time. Without the full duplex, both parties would have to take turns talking.

Images may need tweaking but otherwise great. Results from 35mm negatives were especially pleasing.

qa_pair.question: What kind of batteries do these phone use?
qa_pair.answer: There are no batteries in the base unit.  The handsets each use 2 AAA rechargeable batteries (included). qa_pair.question: Do you have to have a phone "system" (PBX) for the intercom to work, or does it somehow communicate with the other phones without a system box??

qa_pair.answer: No PBX needed. qa_pair.question: What is flexible extension numbering?
qa_pair.answer: Because you can have two or more extensions with this unit; depending on how many more extensions you buy.  Your main unit would be 1.. and you can place an extension unit in your kitchen, den, bedrooms, etc.  You can assign numbers to these extensions as you please. For example you can set your kitchen phone as extension 2, the den as extension 3, so if you want to call the den from whichever phone from the unit then you call the extension 3. Then you can change and re-change these assignments however you like them which makes them flexible.

rewrite.edit: Flexible extension numbering means your main unit would be 1.. and you can place an extension unit in your kitchen, den, bedrooms, etc.  You can assign numbers to these extensions as you please. You can have 2 or more extensions with this unit. Your main unit is 1 and you can place an extension unit in your kitchen or your bedrooms. You can assign numbers to these extensions however you want.

qa_pair.question: What is flexible extension numbering?
qa_pair.answer:
I'll try. It's been years since I set up our 6 phones. The extensions were easy to set up by just going into function/edit mode and scrolling to assign extension #. then identify the various extensions you've connected to your phone lines and assign each one a number as shown from 1 -8 and make a note for yourself so later you can write the location of the extensions on each of the phones. It's very intuitive once you've been a little patient and have taken a few minutes to study it. If you mess up then you can go back and use erase button to clean it up and start over. Once done you can forget it as I have!

qa_pair.question: What is the scan quality - number of pixels?
qa_pair.answer: Default on all scan images is 200 dpi; lowest selectable is 75 dpi and highest is 2400 dpi. The higher the dpi scan the MUCH longer the image scan time. Up to 4-5 minutes for a 5 X 7 or larger 2400 dpi scan image.

summary: This scanner can be fed individually sheet by sheet on the flatbed glass or up to 30 pages at a time using the scanner sheet feed. The printer will accommodate plain stock 8.5 x 11, legal paper 8.5 x 14, and photo paper 4 x 6. The paper tray has a special holder for 4x6 photo paper and 8.5x11 paper, and will print two sided copy. Both sides of a page cannot be faxed at the same time. 2400 dpi is the highest quality of scanner as it has the highest number of pixels. Directions can be found on the manufacturer website. There may be compatibility problems with Macs. Keep in mind that the stark ink cartridges are small and may need to be replaced after a short amount of time.

qa_pair.question: Does this phone have a one button call blocker which will automatically put that number into the call block list without having to input it manually?
qa_pair.answer: Not one button; but, the number does not need to be entered manually.  As soon as I identify the number as one I want to block, I reject the call.  It then appears as the first number in my list of missed calls.  I select "menu" scroll to "Call Block" and select it, then confirm "Yes". qa_pair.question: Have just set up brother mfc-j6520dw but i am very disappointed with the print quality.  Pictures are quite blurred. what have i done wrong?  Gwen D
qa_pair.answer: By default, the printer warms up and goes into "normal" print quality mode, not "best" (what you want) or "fast" (poor/draft quality).  It does this for many reasons, primarily to save ink since most people print typical documents containing mostly text, not graphics.  You can always change the printer's quality from normal to best by going to: Devices & Printers ->  Brother mfc-j6520dw -> Adjust Print Options.  If you mostly print images that require hi-resolution (lots of ink), you can set "best" quality as your default.

qa_pair.question: How do you switch between black and red
qa_pair.answer: Look at the writing on the barrel.  Place the word (black, red, stylus or pencil) on the top.  Press the button on the side to release the current selection and then press the end switch.  Having the word on top when you depress the end switch positions the correct pen or pencil so it comes out the way you want.  It is controlled by gravity.

With the word on top and the end switch positions depressed, the effective pencil/pen comes up in a controlled gravity.

qa_pair.question: Will they write on a black background?
qa_pair.answer: The best answer is no, because they are too fine of a point to show up well on black. Your best bet would be pastel pens with a bolder point.

qa_pair.question: Will they write on a black background?

qa_pair.question: Will they write on a black background?
qa_pair.answer: Interesting question.  I did a little experiment for you.  I picked 10 -15 pens randomly and wrote on black construction paper and also a shiny navy blue card stock school folder.  The lighter colors, particularly the neon and glitter, showed up on the black construction paper similar to an ordinary pencil.  Colored pencils actually showed up better.  And, none of the pens did well on the slick, dark colored paper.

summary: This cabinet will hold both legal and standard size files. Each drawer is legal size and has a metal bar. The cabinet uses bilateral glides rather than a roller or wheeled mechanism. It also has a locking mechanism. It is not finished but features white particle board. Files can be put in laterally but the cabinet may not fit legal size files if put in in this way. The cabinet takes about 30 minutes to assemble and the unit is quite heavy when fully assembled.

summary: The top drawer is for small items and the other can hold files and there are two locks on the top drawers. This product is light weight and easy to handle while being sturdy enough for home use. The product already comes assembled besides the wheels which have to be popped in. qa_pair.question: Does this have Sundays as well?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, however Sunday is compressed to the bottom 1/4 of the last column on a two-page spread.  A two-page spread is divided into 6 columns (3 on each page).  Columns 1 through 5, as you go left to right, are Mon-Fri, each depicting 7 AM-9 PM, in 15 min increments.  The last column (Column 6) shows Sat and Sun.  Sat goes from 7 AM to 5:30 PM, in 15 min increments.  Sun has the equivalent of 3 hours of space divided into 15 min increments, but without the actual numerical digits typed on.

qa_pair.question: what is different between "DN" and "N" modles?
qa_pair.answer: DN (Duplex - both side printing & networking - ethernet)N (networking - ethernet)

qa_pair.question: what is different between "DN" and "N" modles?
qa_pair.answer: The N stands for network, which means it can connect through an Ethernet cable. The D stands for Duplex, which means it can print on both sides of a page automatically. So the N model connects through the network but cannot automatically print both sides of a page, while the DN connects through the network AND prints on both sides.

qa_pair.question: Do the cordless phones have a headset jack?
qa_pair.answer: Yes.  It is the standard 2.5mm. subminiature, three conductor (TRS) jack.  The jack is covered by a flexible rubber dust cover on the left side of the case, adjacent to the digit 7 on the keyboard.  I verified voice function, audio transmitted and received is very good quality.  Note that the connecter standard for cell phones is 3.5 mm, and cannot physically connect to this cordless phone.  I tried multiple headsets, all worked.

summary: The cord on the base of the phone is 2.5 to 3 feet long. Some dimensions differ depending on whether the handset is in the cradle.  It's 7&1/2 " wide.  It's 7 & 1/4 " long but when the handset is in the cradle it changes to 8". Ringers can be turned off on cordless handsets. It has a function to put numbers on a blocked list. You can store up to 100 names and phone numbers, arrange them into up to 9 groups and make calls from the stored list without having to dial the numbers. You can call from one handset to another at same time. The Caller ID button on the main base is labeled CID.

qa_pair.question: Is this printer compatible with an Apple Time Capsule router?
qa_pair.answer: It should be compatible. The Apple Time Capsule Router specs say you can connect a printer via USB or Ethernet. The Brother HL3170CDW printer has both of those options.

qa_pair.question: Is this printer compatible with an Apple Time Capsule router?
qa_pair.answer: Compatibility is a funny thing. I would suggest leaving them alone in a room together a few minutes at first. Then gradually increase the time each day. Watch for increased compatibility as they get to know each other. A true friendship could develop, but possibly only a working relationship  based on familiarity and mutual respect is the best you will get. So, yeah, they are compatible, but don't rush it.

qa_pair.question: Is this printer compatible with an Apple Time Capsule router?

The print quality is very good, setup is easy, very low power consumption, and it functions flawlessly.  You can't beat this printer for the price.  I am very happy with mine, and I highly recommend this printer.

qa_pair.question: Does this printer require a drum unit as well as toner?
qa_pair.answer: The answer is yes.  The toner cartridge (each color) fits in the bracket that holds the drum.  The toner cartridge is what you will need to replace most often.  When the drum needs to be changed you will have a notification on the screen of the printer.

qa_pair.question: Does this printer still print black and white, even if the color toner is not replaced?
qa_pair.answer: Printer came with a pamphlet titled "User Settings on Color/Mono" that clearly describes how to print black only and what scenarios cause the printer to print using the color toner.  It WILL print black if set to mono, even if a color toner is out.

qa_pair.question: Does this printer still print black and white, even if the color toner is not replaced?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, You can choose between Auto, Color or Mono in the Printing Preferences (right-click printer icon) and also on a case-by-case basis by changing the settings on the print dialog. As others have stated, you cannot print if one cartridge is "empty", but this can be bypassed by resetting the cartridge through the printer menu. Google it or check on YouTube for detailed instructions.

qa_pair.question: Does this printer still print black and white, even if the color toner is not replaced?
qa_pair.answer: In my experience, no it doesn't.  Also the printer stops working when the cartridges are "shown" to be empty - when in actuality they aren't.  There is a way to work around this though.  Google this on youtube - for resetting printer cartridges.  My cartridges claimed to be empty just two months after I purchased this printer.  I reset them and they've been running on the same ones for a few weeks now without a problem.

qa_pair.question: Does this printer still print black and white, even if the color toner is not replaced?
qa_pair.answer: After some googling, it seems that printing in black won't use the color toner. However, if ANY of the toner runs out, it won't print. I suppose if you just want to print in black most of the time, use the color toner sparingly.

qa_pair.question: Does this printer still print black and white, even if the color toner is not replaced?
qa_pair.answer: Just to clarify any mixed messages you may have received, the answer is "yes" as long as you have the printer set to "Mono" mode. Here is a quote directly from the pamphlet that comes with the printer: "If either the Cyan, Magenta or Yellow toner reaches the end of its life while printing a color document, the print job cannot be completed. You can cancel your print job and choose to start the print job again in Mono mode, as long as Black toner is available."

qa_pair.question: Does this printer still print black and white, even if the color toner is not replaced?
qa_pair.answer: Good question, I do not know the answer to that because I have only had the printer for 2 months but it was the reason why I will never buy another Epson printer. This printer so far functions wonderfully. Really love it.

qa_pair.question: Does this printer work with card stock?
qa_pair.answer: No! Do not buy this printer if you want to print with decent weight card stock. I don't know why people have answered yes, but I bought this printer and ended up returning because of how poorly it handled card stock.

qa_pair.answer: Absolutely. You can go to settings and print in either color or black and white for both single and duplex printing.

qa_pair.question: When it "automatically" prints on both sides of the paper - is this something that you can change in settings or somewhere if you don't want it to?
qa_pair.answer: When you select "print" from the File menu of whatever application you're printing your document from, you have the option to select whether or not you want double-sided printing. It doesn't print double-sided by default--you have to check that box.

qa_pair.question: When it "automatically" prints on both sides of the paper - is this something that you can change in settings or somewhere if you don't want it to?
qa_pair.answer: To print on both sides you do this in the settings and it prints both sides automatically. The default setting is one sided printing. This one of the reasons I bought this printer as I print contracts with both sides of the paper. This printer for the money is a great machine and value.

qa_pair.question: is black & white only printing also doable
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely. You just choose color on the printer options before sending it off to be printed. All color printers can print in black and white. You just need to see if they print black and white separately. Some printers will mix all colors to make black and white printouts, others have a dedicated black and white cartridge or drum. It is more ideal to have a separate unit for black and white as mixing the colors to make black and white eats the levels of ink or toner very quickly. I hope that makes sense.- Damon

qa_pair.question: is black & white only printing also doable
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely. You can go to settings and print in either color or black and white for both single and duplex printing.
